import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sn
from warnings import filterwarnings
filterwarnings('ignore')
source.1d6824ae:
plt.figure(figsize=(15,15))
sn.barplot(x='Total Cases',y='State/UTs',data=df)
plt.xlabel('Total cases',fontsize=16)
plt.ylabel('States',fontsize=16)
plt.suptitle('Total cases in all the states',fontsize= 28)
plt.title('Scale = 1 Million')
plt.show()
source.4626562b:
plt.figure(figsize=(15,15))
sn.barplot(x='Deaths',y='State/UTs',data=df)
plt.xlabel('Deaths',fontsize=16)
plt.ylabel('States',fontsize=16)
plt.suptitle('Total deaths in all the states',fontsize= 28)
plt.show()
source.83f496b7:
plt.figure(figsize=(15,15))
sn.barplot(x='Death Ratio (%)',y='State/UTs',data=df)
plt.xlabel('Deaths per active cases',fontsize=16)
plt.ylabel('States',fontsize=16)
plt.suptitle('Death ratios in all the states',fontsize= 28)
plt.title('Scale = 1 Million')
plt.show()

source.25047fa2: # Scraping web for some financial insights :
source.2bdc9705: **Almost every state has the same Cases-discharged ratio**
source.f7721ab2: **Since health expenditure and total cases ideally should be inversely proportional to one another, as greater health expenditure means better infrastructure, I drew a line with a negative slope to roughly approximate the curve. Two states/UT have performed poorly, with Maharashtra being the worst performer.**
source.e9477648:
# Summary : 
**Maharashtra has been severely affected and the State Government of Maharashtra does owe it's population a lot of answers.**
source.1690431f: **As per the data, reported deaths in Maharashtra have also been the highest when considering the average amount spent by the sate on healthcare**
